newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul official denies Citizens stake deal report.
newsitem.headline: Seoul official denies Citizens stake deal report.

text.p: An official at South Korea's Finance and Economy Ministry denied on Monday a newspaper report that the government was considering allowing Hyundai Group's takeover of an investment trust firm.
The Chosun Ilbo on Monday quoted an unnamed government source as saying the ministry was considering allowing Hyundai to take a controlling stake in Citizens Investment Trust Management Co.
"It's not true," said a senior official at the ministry.
Hyundai's earlier bids to accumulate shares in the Seoul-based investment trust firm had been aborted by a strong opposition by the government.
Analysts say the Hyundai Group, South Korea's largest conglomerate in terms of assets, wants to take over the investment trust firm in a bid to strengthen its financial business sector.
